publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8019 Jackie Baillie: NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education—That the Parliament welcomes National Union of Students (NUS) Scotland’s new lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) campaign, There’s More to my Education, which seeks to improve the experiences of the LGBT community when accessing mental health services; notes that the campaign’s first reception, networking and lobbying event is scheduled to be held in the main hall on 8 March 2011; considers that mental health and creating positive mental health should be priorities for the Parliament, and believes that mental health services across Scotland should be open and free from judgement on the basis of sexuality and that the Scottish Government should ensure the inclusion of LGBT-specific elements in mental health anti-stigma campaigns.
S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, Mary Scanlon*

S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) Jack McConnell*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Pauline McNeill*, Johann Lamont*, Ken Macintosh*, Claire Baker*, Patrick Harvie*, Mike Pringle*, Des McNulty*, Stewart Maxwell*

S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) Robin Harper*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Wilson*, Patricia Ferguson*, David Whitton*, Trish Godman*, Liam McArthur*, Jamie McGrigor*, Mary Mulligan*, Elaine Smith*, Cathy Peattie*
S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) Maureen Watt*
S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) George Foulkes*
S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-8019 NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education (lodged on 25 February 2011) Annabel Goldie*, Karen Whitefield*

S3M-8019 Jackie Baillie: NUS Scotland LGBT Campaign, There’s More to my Education—That the Parliament welcomes National Union of Students (NUS) Scotland’s new lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) campaign, There’s More to my Education, which seeks to improve the experiences of the LGBT community when accessing mental health services; notes that the campaign’s first reception, networking and lobbying event is scheduled to be held in the main hall on 8 March 2011; considers that mental health and creating positive mental health should be priorities for the Parliament, and believes that mental health services across Scotland should be open and free from judgement on the basis of sexuality and that the Scottish Government should ensure the inclusion of LGBT-specific elements in mental health anti-stigma campaigns. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Mary Scanlon, Jack McConnell, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Pauline McNeill, Johann Lamont, Ken Macintosh, Claire Baker, Patrick Harvie, Mike Pringle, Des McNulty, Stewart Maxwell, Robin Harper, Stuart McMillan, Bill Wilson, Patricia Ferguson, David Whitton, Trish Godman, Liam McArthur, Jamie McGrigor, Mary Mulligan, Elaine Smith, Cathy Peattie, Maureen Watt, George Foulkes, Joe FitzPatrick, Annabel Goldie, Karen Whitefield
